name: Relic Hunters Zero
description: Relic Hunters Zero is a FREE game about shooting evil space ducks and evil space turtles with tiny cute guns. It’s fast, it’s tactical, and feels delicious and smooth to play. Unlock new weapons, characters and relics to defeat the Ducan Commander.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or newer Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Shader Model 2.0 compatible graphic card with at least 512 MB of video memory DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 100 MB available space Additional Notes: Graphic cards with integrated memory such as Intel Graphics not supported
recommended_requirements: Graphics: Graphic Card with at least 1 GB of video memory

reviews.review_text: The Game Is GREAT!  I love the soundtrack I love the gameplay I love the weapons I love the style i currently dont see anything bad with it.  and my rating is: 10/10  EDIT:  Oh and it reminds me of Nuclear Throne

Free game, extremely polished, fantastic gameplay. Local co-op is sick, I would like to see an online co-op but wonder about netcode problems. I really hope the developer decides to release weapons/enemies/levels as paid content packs because I want to throw dollars at them.

This game is free, and it's more fun than most games you can buy today  It's got tight controls, collectables, and lots of replayability.   Pro:  As mentioned previously, Tight controls  An environment that compliments said controls  Shooting feels good, and there's so many guns to use  Graphically pleasing  Different characters to play as  Fairly challenging  Neat relic system  Endless mode providing replayability   Con:  The soundtrack is very... Meh...  Some of the enemies act a lot like dogs and it might make you feel bad for killing them   The cons aren't really cons, I just couldn't think of anything really bad to say.  If this sounds like something cool to you go right ahead and play it, it's a free game.

I'm absolutely in love with this game!  The art style is adorable, the gameplay is challenging and addictive and it's free!  Hell, I wouldn't hestitate to pay for this. It's great to see that there are still developers that just care about the joy in gaming and not about money.

I've only played this for around an hour at time of reviewing, but this game is great, I can see why it has 96% positive (at time of review) I don't think it has online Co-op just yet but if you have a buddy or like playing games solo then give it a shot, reminds me of Nuclear Throne alot, haven't played that much either but still, both very good games :)  EDIT 8/31/2015: I'm now just noticing that the Devs do not want to add online Co-op. I will still suggest this game and do not blame them, working on another huge thing after the game's already released is hard, he (they not sure) said that if anybody wants to mod in online he'd try to support but he won't work on it. I don't blame him and GL to anybody that wants to make online Co-op.

It doesn't feel so 'modern' as most new games in this genre. It doesn't have odd mouse movement, or a camera that follows the mouse, it's nice and simple and it has a fantastic atmosphere. And gotta love that music.

Relic Hunters Zero is a great twin stick shooter rogue-like in the vein of Nuclear Throne, Dungeon Souls and Teleglitch. The genre is increasingly popular and this entry is well worth your time especially since it's free to play:         YouTube™ Video:  Relic Hunters Zero - Free To Play - Relic Hunters Zero Gameplay PC - Relic Hunters Steam

Pixel style games are making a comeback, and when a game uses this principle and manages to still be fun is a welcome game to me.  Relic Hunters Zero is entertaining as an arcade style of game. It's simplistic gameplay, loads of collectibles and agreeable challenge factor give it major bonus points.  I find that some of the weapons are difficult to use, especially my go-to in shooters, the sniper rifle. I find that it's range is not at all what it could be, which is disappointing for anyone that wants to take enemies out from afar.  Also, the game's overall story is built on very little backstory, as if you are tossed into a fight that you have no idea is going on. This takes away from the interest, as I'm left questioning what is going on at all times.  That being said, what this game lacks in story is made up for in its charming and fun style of gameplay. This 2D shooter lets you roam through a variety of areas with a loadout of your choice, and you can either take out your enemies quietly or blow them to smithereens, taking the terrain with you.  Final verdict, Relic Hunters Zero is a good game all and all, because its fun and it has a bit of charm to it. The collection feature is a great way to boost playtime. It may lack in a few areas, but it makes up for them well enough that it doesn't matter. I can destroy my enemies and the whole world as I please! Mwahahaha!  Final Mark: 3/5 stars

I'd give this game a solid 10/10 for what it is.

Relic Hunters Zero is free, which is a shame. It's a fun shooter with some kind of Roguelike elements. You're basically shooting Ducks from outer space, and man... They hit hard.  I'd gladly pay for this game, like, seriously.

Digging for treasure is easy:  The color corresponds to the closeness White - far Blue - close Red - within 1~3 box  The red region will be within the blue region and the blue within the white. The treasure might be all around the map, so move and find.  Once you learn this, you won't waste the first hour trying to dig up the treasure in one spot, but be able to have wham bam fun.  It's not as easy as it seems I assure you ;)

I've only been playing for a week before I posted this review. I gotta say, I would've expected stuff like DLC or something to make us pay one way or another. That's how free games go on about nowadays.  However, these developers have returned the feeling of tingly warm sensation of generosity! For a game this good, it feels like it should be worth ten dollars or so. Instead of slapping a price tag, they just hand it to us, showing phenomenal artwork with pixel graphics so good, it brings back the old days. Music fits in well, and everything feels alive.  Focusing on game play, it really dives in the arcade feel. -It has 6 characters, all having unique stats and some having different game play. How they shoot, punch, use their grenades, or even what weapons they start off with. The variety of your tactics mixing with these characters make a lot of difference, but fun nonetheless. -Each of them has the following standard. -Health determines how much hits you can take before you get K.O.'d -Shield acts as a barrier for your health, and can recharge if you're safe from attacks long enough. -Grenades are throwable bombs for most characters. Some may use it differently however, like Pinkyy uses it for an invincible barrier for a short time. -Ammo, ranging from Light, Medium, and Heavy, it refills your guns clip depending on what kind of gun you have.  The game features two modes.  -Adventure Mode would be considered as 'Story Mode', or 'Campaign'. It holds 4 stages, each having 3 acts to complete the stage, then followed up by a boss known as Duke Duncan. The Adventure Mode is short, but is meant to be replayed as it offers 'Relics' that can be obtained through these levels or by buying them. (Not real money of course) Shoot or bust your way through these levels with planned out maneuvers or fast tactics. Watch your surrounding whether it's a crowd full of enemies, a cage full of dangerous beasts, an explosive box, or breakable barriers. The environment is there, and how you go about is up to you.  -Endless Mode is more or less like Adventure Mode. The only difference? It's mixing in with dungeon curses! The disadvantage occurs during the stage, sabotaging you or supporting the enemy. Now with even more troubles to worry about, you'll have to watch your ammo, health, shield, and your surroundings! Along the lines, there are even more relics to unlock and an exclusive weapon upgrade! Try the game and feel the difference!  -Rating- Price Range: More than Generous! Game play: Fast, Smooth, Tactical, and lots of Arcade fun without the use of quarters! Overall: 10/10 - No risk in trying something that's free!

I picked this up a while ago, but just tried it, and... I gotta say... I don't get the pissy negative reviews, its FREE and REALLY FUN! there's no microtransactions, to pay to win or wait to win, its just straight-up free.  like I'd pay probably $5 to $10 for this game (but I'm just a weenie who supports indie devs)  But real quick imma put the pros and cons and be like everyone else  +It's literally ♥♥♥♥ing free. There is no money you can or have to spend on this game. +Despite being completely free, it plays very well and has tight controls (on KBAM, never tried a controller, prefer KBAM for most games like this anyway, just my preference) +Super charming and realised art style, very pleasant to look at +Sound design is minimalistic, but again, charming and satisfying +Game feedback (screen shakes and hit sounds and such) is satisfying +It's open-source if you're into that! Aspiring game devs and experienced alike can poke around in the source code freely +Plenty of replayability added through a persistant unlock system (new characters, weapons I haven't unlocked yet, etc)  -No online co-op (doesnt kill it for me, but apparently a selling point for others) -I can see how some would see it as short or repetitive, but I won't complain for the low, low price of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ FREE -SOME, not all, may not like the game's aesthetic... that's about it...  how yall gonna complain about a completely free game, made for YOU, THE GAMERS

Damn, this game is pretty fun. Combine that with a boppin'/boopin' soundtrack, cute graphics, and IT ALL BEING  FREE,  this is a solid little experience.  Even if it is a little easy to cheese the final boss with Pinkyy.
It's like an easier to get into Nuclear Throne. It's actually similar to Nuclear Throne except everyone has a roll and the game is much less frantic overall, would easily recommend.
10/10 This game is really cool. The music can be kind of loud and high-pitched at times, but the style is cool. It is really engaging addictive. I like it a lot!
This is SO good, I would pay for it if necessary, good retro graphics and music, addictive gameplay and it's always fun to play, I would like to see online multiplayer in the future!

Nothing to complain about with the game being free. It's short yea, but it definetly has some solid replay value to it. Combot is fast paced and will keep you on your toes. I believe the game is randomized and the relic hunting aspect gives you something to play through again for. Only slight complaint I have is that the melee character seems to be a little underpowered. Well, she definetly has enough POWER, but she feels a little squishy. I realize with the melee it's high rish high reward, but I find when playing with her, most situations call for gun combat as going in and trying to melee would result in my death or taking a lot of shots. I know she shouldn't/isn't a tank (since there is a character dedicated to that) but I think she should have a sheild that can take more than 3 or 4 hits from most enemies. Despite that, she's still playable and not broken in any sense. 10/10 great little gem

PLEASE AD SOME DLC! I want more, and i want to support the Devs. Great game. PROS: -Fun, quick gameplay -Pick-up and play game -local co-op -Cute characters -nice pixel art -controller compatibilty -loads of weapons -loads of unlockables -loads of characters -Completely free game with NO DLC or microtransactions -Controls well  CONS: -Bit of a short game -No online play (Yet)  TL;DR: 8/10.

I love this game. The graphics, sound and gameplay remind me of classic retro games where you move and shoot or punch. Finding relics to use is always gratifying since it can take a while sometimes. This game rewards you and introduces to new things every single time you move to the next tage or zone.  Godd things I like: 1. Variety of characters after you unlock them. Which sometimes just takes time. 2. Weapons and specials are fun to use against enemies.  3. Relics are fun and gives a hand in some cases. 4. Co-op is fun 5. Endless mode is a good thing to play.  Only draw backs for me is:  1. sometimes it gets hard (Like stupid hard) but depends how you take it. 2. No online for those that want to play online 3. There is a story some what but its not all chat chat or cutscene really. It has Lore but the game is not heavy on it. 4. You probably wont take the game serious when you find out you fight ducks. 'DUCKS'

I know my time is short, but this game is fun! It's a amazing 2d shooter that is easy to pick up! However theres only one problem I have with this game. Relics are to hard to find! The levels are large, so finding the relic piece can take a long time, and is repetitive. The relic finding system needs to be better.

Relic Hunters Zero is a pretty fun game. It has good characters and decent levels. The weapons and tactics are amazing! The varity of weapons to choose are pretty good, Including the weapons previously given to the player before choosing yor weapons .3.  Overall, this game is pretty gud, and has some good enemies with some difficult challenges. But, if you have a good enough stradegy, you could master this game. That's why I like to try my best on all levels :D

A great game, good replay value. But it's great either way, i recommend this game.
